timeline.message: 6885 bundle merged files, select mini timeline by default
6985 some fixes for comments and names
6985 final clean up of mini timeline before initial pr

timeline.bodyText: Should the InterruptedException here be treated as a cancellation?
timeline.author: gdicristofaro

replies.bodyText: I don't think it should at this point, since we only want to entirely ignore things if the swing worker is cancelled in which case there will be a cancellation exception instead of an interruptedexception.
replies.author: wschaeferB

timeline.bodyText: It would help readability if this was broken up into multiple lines.
timeline.author: gdicristofaro

timeline.bodyText: It looks like this file was generated with the gui designer.  Is there are corresponding .form file?
timeline.author: gdicristofaro

timeline.author: wschaeferB

timeline.message: 6985 fix exception when caching cancelled during minitimeline population
6985 fix exception handling for artifact type tabs
6985 break up long lines for readability

timeline.bodyText: I think the CancellationException is thrown if the get method is called after the swing worker has been cancelled and the InterruptedException is thrown if a waiting thread receives an interrupt during cancellation based on https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/concurrency/cancel.html and https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/javax/swing/SwingWorker.html#get(). I'm not seeing anything in your get method that would directly throw an InterruptedException so it is probably okay, but if the background method was changed to use, say the cache or a sql query directly where an InterruptedException could potentially be thrown, it might be good to treat as a cancellation.
timeline.author: gdicristofaro

timeline.message: 6985 fix failure to load first time
